p: The other important algal pigments are the phycobiliproteins, which are water-soluble proteins and highly fluorescent compounds synthesized by blue-green and red algae [ 7, 47]. These NPM are classified into the three categories of phycoerythrins, allophycocyanins, and phycocyanins [ 47]. These photosynthetic pigments have various significant pharmaceutical and health-improving applications, such as their use in histochemistry, immunoassays, flow cytometry, and cell imaging. They can be used for reactive oxygen substances (ROS) detection based on the antioxidant properties when isolated from Porphyra sp. [ 47]. Phycobiliproteins from macroalgae can also be used as natural colorings in chewing gums, dairy products, cosmetics and other products [ 56].
